objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) is the primary author and publisher of this report. The NCSC analyzed and described the Rhythmic Parry malware, detailing its characteristics, anti-analysis techniques, and associated indicators.

objects.name: C2 domain, LocalData.dll
objects.description: Hardcoded command and control domain used for HTTP beaconing by LocalData.dll variant of Rhythmic Parry.

objects.name: C2 domain, DiagView.dll
objects.description: Hardcoded command and control domain used for HTTPS beaconing by DiagView.dll variant of Rhythmic Parry.

objects.name: Mutex name, LocalData.dll
objects.description: Unique mutex created for execution by LocalData.dll; used to prevent multiple malware instances.

objects.name: Mutex name, DiagView.dll
objects.description: Unique mutex created for execution by DiagView.dll; used to prevent multiple malware instances.

objects.name: Log file, LocalData.dll
objects.description: Log file created in temp directory by LocalData.dll variant for error tracking; filename is derived from configuration string, no extension used.

objects.name: Log file, DiagView.dll
objects.description: Log file created in temp directory by DiagView.dll variant for error tracking; filename is derived from configuration string, no extension used.

objects.name: Beacon URI, LocalData.dll
objects.description: Malicious HTTP URI used by LocalData.dll for beaconing to its C2 domain.

objects.name: Beacon URI, DiagView.dll
objects.description: Malicious HTTPS URI used by DiagView.dll for beaconing to its C2 domain.

objects.name: Indicator for LocalData.dll (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of Rhythmic Parry LocalData.dll malicious downloader (HTTP C2).

objects.name: Indicator for LocalData.dll (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of Rhythmic Parry LocalData.dll malicious downloader (HTTP C2).

objects.name: Indicator for LocalData.dll (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of Rhythmic Parry LocalData.dll malicious downloader (HTTP C2).

objects.name: Indicator for DiagView.dll (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of Rhythmic Parry DiagView.dll malicious downloader (HTTPS C2).

objects.name: Indicator for DiagView.dll (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of Rhythmic Parry DiagView.dll malicious downloader (HTTPS C2).

objects.name: Indicator for DiagView.dll (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of Rhythmic Parry DiagView.dll malicious downloader (HTTPS C2).

objects.name: rhythmic parry
objects.description: Rhythmic Parry is a 64-bit downloader malware targeting the Windows operating system. It downloads, decrypts, and executes AES-256-CBC encrypted payloads from a command and control server, using HTTP or HTTPS communication channels. The malware heavily leverages anti-analysis and obfuscation techniques, including extensive junk code, dynamic resolution of imports, and encoded configuration strings. Persistence is achieved by setting itself up as a scheduled task. The malware verifies downloaded payloads via SHA-256 hash comparison and runs the payload in a new thread, pre-resolving common APIs used by shellcode.

objects.name: rp_config_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule rp_config_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Base64 and XOR encoded strings which in plaintext
appear in both samples of Rhythmic Parry."
        date = "2022-01-10"
        hash1 = "628cf9ace06af1d0985fce3c5c39ab0773135c00"
        hash2 = "af895002b93854de0eb6f17dc4823a50c7bd08f5"
    strings:

$LD_UA =

"OQALACoADAACAAMAEABbAFEAfgBVAE4ARwAmAB0ACgA0AAoAGQAcAFEAOgAwAHAAVABeAEEA
QQBPAEQABwAMAAAAWQBFAE8ARAAoAFMAWgBGAFEANQAUACAACQALADgAFAAWAC8AOQARAEEAW
gBCAEMASgBjAFMATgBHADoAPAAwAB0AKQBCAE8AHQAdAA8ANQBFACkACgASAB8ACwB5AEUALQ
AHAAMAGwAJADUASgBaAF0AXwBEAEoAYgBWAF8AXgBfAEUAVwBlAEUAPQAOABcAFQAWADkASgB
bAFwARgBaAFcAZgBFACsACwAWABEASwBhAFcAQABdAEUAQgA=" wide

$DV_UA =

"GgA5ADAAPgAjAC0AMgB4AGMAZABnAG8AaQAEAD4AOAAuADgAOAAyAHMAGQACAGoAZgB/AG8A
YwBsAHYAHQA+ACEAdwBnAGwAdgAyAGEAewBoAHMAFgAmADoAOwAqABYANgA1AB0AIwAjAGAAd
ABgAGAAeAB5AGEAbwBpABgAHwACAAcAGwBjAGEAPwA+AD0ALwB3AAgAJAAwADwAOQBjAHcADA
ApACEAOAA7AC8AeAB7AHMAfQBnAHgAeABkAH4AcAB9AGYAZQB/AHcAHAAgADUANgAkACMAeAB
6AHIAZAB5AGUAfAB3AAoAJQA0ADIAeQB7AGUAYQBzAGcAYQA=" wide

$LD_EXP =

"FwBeAAwAOQAZAAYAHwAQAAsAJwAWADIAMwAUAAwAFAA8AAoAHAAKAAMAWgABACgAAAA="
wide

$DV_EXP =

"NABsABYACwA4ACgAPQAzADkAPQAkABMAHQA2AC8AJgAmADgAPQAkACEAeQAzADIAMgA="
wide

    condition:

uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and (2

of ($LD_*) or 2 of ($DV_*))
}

objects.name: rp_junk_code
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule rp_junk_code {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Highlights common junk code sections identified in
both Rhythmic Parry samples."
        date = "2022-01-10"
        hash1 = "628cf9ace06af1d0985fce3c5c39ab0773135c00"
        hash2 = "af895002b93854de0eb6f17dc4823a50c7bd08f5"

    strings:

$post_writefile = {C7 84 24 ?? ?? 00 00 00 00 00 00 48 8B 84 24 ??

?? 00 00 48 89 8C 24 ?? ?? 00 00 48 89 C1 48 8D 05 ?? ?? ?? 00 89 94 24
?? ?? 00 00 48 89 C2 41 B8}

$temp_path_a = {41 B8 C8 00 00 00 89 8C 24 ?? ?? 00 00 44 89 C1}

    condition:

uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and

filesize > 500KB and (#temp_path_a > 30) and (#post_writefile > 12)
}

objects.name: rp_import_obfuscation
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule rp_import_obfuscation {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Import obfuscation is achieved by pushing
immediate character values onto the stack while applying single byte
global XOR to each, the global XOR is reinitiated each time it is
applied. This rule highlights the four-instruction sequence to achieve
this."
        date = "2022-01-10"
        hash1 = "628cf9ace06af1d0985fce3c5c39ab0773135c00"
        hash2 = "af895002b93854de0eb6f17dc4823a50c7bd08f5"

    strings:

$char_sequence_eax = {0F BE 05 [4] 83 F0 ?? 88 C1 88 8C 24 [4] 0F

BE 05}
    condition:

uint16(0) == 0x5A4D and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and

#char_sequence_eax > 20
}

objects.name: rp_hash_payload
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule rp_hash_payload {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Hash comparison routine used to check downloaded
payload in Rhythmic Parry samples."
        date = "2022-01-10"
        hash1 = "628cf9ace06af1d0985fce3c5c39ab0773135c00"
        hash2 = "af895002b93854de0eb6f17dc4823a50c7bd08f5"
    strings:

$hash_1 = {0F BE ?? ?? 48 8B 44 24 ?? ?? 63 ?? 24 ?? ?? 0F BE}

        $hash_2 = {0F 84 08 00 00 00 C7 44 24 ?? 00 00 00 00 E9 00 00 00
00 8B 44 24 ?? 83 C0 01 89 44 24 ?? E9 ?? ?? FF FF}

$hash_3 = {C7 44 24 ?? 01 00 00 00 48 8B ?? 24 [1-5] 48 89 44 24 ??

48 83 [3-6] 00 0F 85 0D 00 00 00 C7 44 24 ?? 00 00 00 00 E9}

    condition:

(uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and

all of them
}

objects.name: rp_xor_routine
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule rp_xor_routine {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Targets the XOR routine used to decode
configuration strings in both observed Rhythmic Parry samples."
        date = "2022-01-10"
        hash1 = "628cf9ace06af1d0985fce3c5c39ab0773135c00"
        hash2 = "af895002b93854de0eb6f17dc4823a50c7bd08f5"
    strings:

$xor_1 = {48 8B ?? 24 ?? [0-3] 48 63 ?? 24 ?? [0-3] 0F B? 14 ?8 48
63 ?? 24}
        $xor_2 = {45 31 C0 89 54 24 ?? 44 89 C2 48 F7 ?? 24 ?? [0-3] 44
(0F BE 84 14|8A 8C)}
        $xor_3 = {00 00 66 45 89 C1 45 0F B7 C1 44 8B 54 24 ?? 45 31 C2
66 45 89 D1}
    condition:

(uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and 2

of them
}

objects.name: Scheduled Task/Job: Scheduled Task
objects.description: Rhythmic Parry has been installed as a Scheduled Task to maintain persistence.

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Binary Padding
objects.description: Rhythmic Parry contains junk code with a consistent pattern, including unused exports and indirect calls.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: Rhythmic Parry hard-coded configuration strings are XOR-encoded with a 6-byte key, then Base64-encoded.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: Rhythmic Parry uses HTTP or HTTPS to download a payload from a C2 server.

objects.name: Encrypted Channel: Symmetric Cryptography
objects.description: Rhythmic Parry downloads a second-stage payload which is encrypted using AES-256-CBC with an IV of zero.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Rhythmic Parry
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. rhythmic parry.
